tweet: I now call on Members of Congress to come together on a legislative solution to strengthen border security and fix our broken immigration laws once and for all. I look forward to the President signing this bill into law.

This bill is long overdue and I’m pleased the Democrats chose to accept what was a strong, common-sense solution to begin with. This bill is a compassionate solution that will help the children at our southern border by providing $4.6 billion to address our humanitarian crisis.

Almost 8% of American adults experience #PTSD in their life and around 11-20% of veterans have PTSD. You can help by sharing resources available through @DeptVetAffairs' website:  https://www.ptsd.va.gov/  #PTSDAwarenessMonth pic.twitter.com/wR03O3joif

The Senate just acted in good faith & passed bipartisan legislation to provide $4.6 billion in humanitarian aid to alleviate the crisis at our southern border. I urge @SpeakerPelosi to take up this package as passed for a vote ASAP.

Republicans have put forth legislative solutions to alleviate the humanitarian crisis at our border. If Democrats truly wanted to help those suffering, they would not have waited until this week – when the crisis is at a breaking point – to act. https://www.foxnews.com/opinion/rep-michael-mccaul-border-crisis-immigration-democrats-house-politics …

Earlier this week I called for immediate humanitarian aid to help the unaccompanied children at our southern border. I stand by this call. Instead of working with Republicans to find a solution, House Democrats put forward a partisan bill. MORE ⇓  http://bit.ly/2Xclv7l  pic.twitter.com/ksoxMhUY3r
